div.p: Greetings. We have diligently read all the writings on excommunication and are now finally sending them back, which we would have done sooner if we had not lacked a suitable messenger. The advice is pleasing and perhaps will please even more in the future, those whom the practice of things and daily experience will render as teachers. I especially thank you for sharing them and for allowing Dr. Erastus's authority to have such influence with you.
Even Dr. Haller, along with the others, sends you greetings. Farewell.
To the most esteemed man, Dr. Heinrich Bullinger, faithful minister of Christ and his honorable lord, etc.
